question: 丸ごと
sourceMnemonic: If you go to (<ja>ごと</ja>) a <kanji>circle</kanji>, you need to go to it <vocabulary>in its entirety</vocabulary>. That means you have to circle around the <vocabulary>whole</vocabulary> thing. Otherwise, it isn't even a circle. It's like a line or a squiggle or something.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned this reading, so you should be able to read this too!
